comment: I'm not sure why Professor Crider has such a low rating, but I am so glad that I took her. Her tests are literally based on the PowerPoints which are pretty short and easy to comprehend/learn. She offers extra credit that will help boost your grade. Just be cautious of due dates because most of the homework is due before your class period!

Had her for A&P I and II and she's a great professor! she does read off powerpoints a lot but her exams are very straight-forward to the powerpoints and learning objectives. Extra credit is also offered. As long as you put in the effort to study you'll be good!

Not a bad lab professor but also not the best. My lab professor for 2251 explained and showed us where each structure was on models, something Crider doesn't do. Mainly reads the powerpoint and then it's on you to figure out the anatomy. Very monotone voice, accidentally fell asleep once lol. She's nice and answers emails within a decent time frame

Lab was difficult and required some time to study as usual but an A is really possible. The professor mostly goes over the slides without adding much extra detail and has a monotonous way of talking which can make it hard to stay engaged. Take pictures of the models, use purpose games, and study the structure lists and you should be okay! :)

Expected more from the department chair and gives mom vibes with her voice, fell asleep every class. Very sweet & great one on one & answering questions. Had her for lab and lecture and was late a lot. Tests were pretty hard and strict on due dates. Attendance was optional. Quick at answering emails. Learned more from a sub in lab one day then her.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a decent teacher but I would not take her again. She is very boring and talks so monotone that I can't pay attention. I went to one of her lectures and it was the same. She is not engaging and doesn't make the course interesting at all. My friend had to teach herself after each class. Her class is not awful though, just not for everyone.

She did read off powerpoints a lot but her powerpoints were EXTREMELY similar to the exams. She was very nice and like any anatomy class you have to put in the work and study hard, which is why I think a lot of people complain about doing bad in her class without putting in time outside to study. She also has guided notes for all of her ppts!

Disappointing instructor. Reads from the slides. Style was monotonous. Instead of making the course enjoyable, made it feel like a chore. Dismissive when trying to approach for help or clarification, often making me feel put down rather than supported.Made what could have been a fun and engaging course into a frustrating and negative experience.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is the worst professor I have ever had. She takes ages to answer her emails, even when it is a final test issue that she had. I would not recommend even to my biggest enemy

If you want to pass this class, then you have to put effort into studying. Her lecture notes are extremely helpful for reviewing and grasping the information. Her tests aren't difficult if you prepare for them using the lecture notes as they go over most learning objectives. Great mnemonics, I wouldn't take anyone else.
Lectures were just her reading off the ppts. She new what she was talking abt and was super nice. But i never went to class because me taking notes at home was the same as going to class.
Worst professor Ive ever had in my life. Took her twice and barely passed. Reads off of a powerpoint the entire semester and never engages with the class. Take literally anyone else
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: A&P 2 lab has a lot of content to cover and I would not have any other professor. While a large part of the class had to do with the effort you put in, Dr. Crider is very knowledgeable and is always there to lend a hand and help break down anything you have a question on.
A&P 2 is a very tough course, but Dr. Crider does as much as she can to help out with that!

I had Dr. Crider for both the A&P Lecture/Lab. I passed with an A+ for both semesters. That being said, this IS a challenging course, and if you do not devote time to this class you will NOT PASS. Dr. Crider sends plenty announcements that can't be missed. Dr. Crider is an awesome lecturer and delivers concepts very well. If you want to pass, STUDY
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The Lab consists of 3 Practical exams, Pre/Post Labs, and attendance. You have to take responsibility for YOUR education. Dr.crider will help explain things if you get stumped. Challenging course, but you have to change your studying habits if you do not see the grades you want. STUDY! Anyone can pass if they put the time. Def would take her again!

She is the best A&P2 professor; has clear, detailed lectures along with fun activities you usually do with a partner. online Pre and post lab quizzes are easy. 3 lab exams, straight forward most are identifying, so you'll pass. easy a!!!

I have taken Crider twice and I don't like her teaching style. You can attend every lab, complete all homework assignments, & do the ONE extra credit assignment she decided to give at the end of the semester and still not make the grade you need! She is knowledgeable but, I would reconsider who you take for lab.

Only teacher that teaches A&P that don't give extra credit. Test are 70% with no extra credit at all. She is very strict on assignment deadline and will not open anything or give warnings that we have assignments due. Do not take if you want to pass with an A or B. She is super nice tho

Dr. Crider does an amazing job at going over the things you need to know for the test and is always there to help out with any questions you have during lab. As long as you take the time to study the material on your own you can get through this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: She is a great professor and does an amazing job at teaching anatomy even though it is a tough course

Dr. Crider is an incredible professor. Anatomy is a hard class regardless of who you take, you have to be prepared to study because the class is heavy on tests but thats how all anatomy classes are. Dr. Crider gives funny ways to remember things and she cares about you if you lean in. Study hard and youll do good.

This class is made up of a LOT of information, but Professor Crider was very helpful when understanding the content. She came up with ways to remember content that helped a lot when it came to studying. The class is test heavy, so that will require a lot of studying. There were also pre and post lab assignments and assignments due before tests.
Worst professor I've ever had. Both times I had her I almost failed. Boring lectures and very difficult tests. take McGee instead I got an A with her and Maddox.

I'm not sure why Dr. Crider has so many bad reviews. She's extremely nice and caring for students. The class is quite test heavy, but it is not horrible. She is strict about deadlines. Assignments outside of the schedule did happen, but she sent several reminders about due dates and times. Expect to study some. I would definitely take her again!

I don't understand why Dr. Crider has such bad ratings... She cares for her students and provides a lot of resources for you to be ready for the exams. She gives study guides/Learning objectives for every single chapter and guided notes too. There is LA and SI available. A&P is hard, but Dr. C is great, you just have to pay attention and study!

You must do your part in learning the material, there is plenty of resource provided for one's optimal use. That being said, if you think you're going to pass just by attending class,  you will not. Overall, it is easy once you understand the material, and she is very helpful and will answer any questions you may have.

This is one of the worst professors I've ever had. Do not register for this class unless u want sleepless nights and depression. I basically had to teach myself bc every lecture consisted of her reading directly from the PowerPoint. PowerPoints have basic definitions and exams ask complex questions. had to watch youtube and do research for answers.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Stay away and look at other profs. The material towards the last few units (reproductive, urinary, etc.) had wrong information on them. She gives incredibly difficult quizzes that are heavily weighted that have wrong answers on them and goes over information that had not been taught yet. Would not take again.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: honestly stay away. she is a very sweet lady but does not know what she's talking about half the time. her test are so hard and she makes you take a quiz about a week before each test when you haven't even covered all the material on the quiz. The home work is easy but barely does anything for your grade. I most likely will be retaking this class.

Class was pretty much a waste of time anyway, but a requirement for my major. Attendance policy is absolutely ridiculous. 3+ absences and your grade drops a letter point, 5 or more and you get an automatic F in the class. Still have no clue behind the point of the QQRP project. Dr.Crider is nice, but I wouldn't take her again for any class.

She is an awful teacher, all she does is read from the powerpoint. She acts like she knows what she is talking about but it doesn't seem like it when you ask questions and all she says is "I'll get to that later" and never does. She doesn't ever finish her lectures and pushes the information to the next test. Her quizzes have info we havent covered

Overall, Dr.Crider is a very sweet person. But she is EXTREMELY smart, almost so smart that she doesn't realize all of this material is brand new to majority of her students. Her lectures consist of her reading word for word off of very lengthy powerpoints. Her exams are extremely rough and she doesn't provide much material to help you on them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Crider is very sweet and understanding, although she's a bit disorganized sometimes. I've found she's very understanding and responsive to my emails. Exams are the majority of your grade, technically following the PP and they are very specific. She makes jokes and analogies in her lectures to help you. A&P is a content heavy class, studying rq
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Her reviews are a catfish..she is terrible. Other lectures received practice tests and study guides with test information. She gives an outline and learning objectives, reads off of slides, and then randomly gives attendance quizzes like she's teaching something. ALSO, she unfairly bumps the students that she likes test scores. Don't take her.

BIOL 2221 is a hard. Doesn't teach but if you learn outside of class you will pass. The test are like her power point (to a certain point). She is always late to everything and she makes excuses about it. But when you have a legit excuse you won't get leniency, unless it life or death. She doesn't offer any learning material except her powerpoints.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I don't even rate professors bc I never felt the need to but if I can help someone out there in order to prevent a semester full of stress, confusion, headaches and overall regret from registering for this teacher, I'll rate. Get ready to read bc you're practically gonna have to teach yourself. Exams will make or break u so prepare or take sb diff

Never failed a class until taking her. Displayed no signs of understanding for students. Very strict grader. Doesn't really teach, just reads. Always late to class and students line up outside the class waiting for her to get there and open the door. Doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner. Her crappy jokes make the lectures more confusing.

It took her 3 months to respond, correct and credit me an assignment that I missed after providing a doctor's notice!! Her exams are EXTREMELY detailed!! She is NOT sympathetic or understanding at all. If you are illiterate she's perfect for you bc all she does is read verbatim off the powerpoint.
if you miss more than 3 classes you fail. i had a lot going on this semester so i wasnt able to come to class and i missed assignments she didnt let me make up and didnt let turn in late
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Crider is pretty strict and very detailed on tests. Your whole grade is essentially exams. She is accessible but you basically have to be dying to get an excuse for not showing up. Tbf, she only takes participation once or twice a unit. Not and easy A, but if you put a ton of effort into studying you can do ok. Her lab is the same but harder.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Reads verbatim off PowerPoint. Attendance is randomly taken for 1 or 2 days for each unit. Her tests are INSANELY detailed. I don't recommend it unless you can memorize every word in the PowerPoint and textbook.
Pretty much just regurgitates the PowerPoint and reads word for word

PPs are clear and concise, if sometimes a little vague (she explains things more indepth in lecture so BE THERE). Exams are ~90% based on the PPs. Use her fill-out notes to review the lecture before class and you'll kill all the exams. I was hospitalized the semester I took her, and her kindess and teaching ability are the only reasons I made an A.
Dr. Crider is the sweetest. She helped us during lab experiments and explained the concept thoroughly. I just wish she talked louder because it was hard for me to hear what she was saying.

It was set up like most Lab classes. Very test heavy and weekly assignments. Do well on the exams, they make up 75% of your grade. The "Extra credit" offered was so small it barely made a dent in anyone's grade.

AP 2 is hard. Do not take this class with any other science if you can. Her exams weren't always the best. Questions were tricky. They were NOT based on her powerpoints alone. You have to read the textbook in addition & possibly watch youtube videos in your freetime. If you can take Parente for AP 2, take HIM! I got an A in AP1 under him.

Dr. Crider is good at getting material to students. If it was going to be on a test it was on a PowerPoint. I will say I was slightly bored in class and struggled to stay focused which is never really a problem for me. If you are just looking to pass a class pick this professor. If you are looking to enjoy a class and strive to do better look away.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Shes so sweet. she helps with anything in your lab, and is very kind towards students. Labs are fun in my opinion, and you work with a partner. pre and post lab quizzes but they were easy. Tests are easy as well if you study, pretty straightforward.

Dr. Crider is so awesome! She gives you fill in the blank notes which keep you engaged in class. Her lectures are always interesting. Good bit of extra credit. Class not mandatory but encouraged. Totally worth choosing the 8 am.

Professor Crider is very caring and chill, I would take her again if I could. Her exams are straight off the powerpoints and she posts study guides for the exam. The exams are somewhat difficult but not too hard if you study. She will give quite a lot of extra credit opportunities which really helps. Overall an amazing person and very relatable.

Dr. Crider is so nice! In lab she always prepared detailed prelab ppts to help us understand the content better. Shes also easy to reach and is willing to answer questions or help when needed. She was a bit unorganized though, as it took some time to get scores back

She is very nice but obviously anatomy isn't a hard class. Her tests are all based on her powepoints which isn't too bad, it's just a lot of information. She gives a lot of other assignments which aren't hard, and a decent amount of extra credit. If you memorize her powerpoints you should be good!
